messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] what is unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: ... I certainly do, and other than answering direct questions (which I ll take offlist if you prefer), I d prefer to discuss unschooling too. ... Thanks for
messages.messageBody:
At 3:01 PM +0000 6/3/04, Ren Allen wrote:
>I don't think it belongs here because I want the list to stay true
>to it's purpose of helping newer folks understand unschooling and
>the lifestyle. I hope everyone understands.

I certainly do, and other than answering direct questions (which I'll
take offlist if you prefer), I'd prefer to discuss unschooling too.

>But if there is a list that is talking about this, please post it so
>that it can be discussed by those that want to further explore the
>issue.

Thanks for the kind invitation, Ren!

There's some really good discussion on these lists:

AHA-Discussion
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/AHA-Discussion

AHA-Political Action
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/AHA-PoliticalAction

HEM-Networking
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/HEM-Networking

HEM-NewHomeschoolers (was Unschooling-101)
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/HEM-NewHomeschoolers

Some of these lists have moved beyond the topic, others are still
wrestling with it. Check the list archives back to Sunday, when I
posted my statement, for all the responses.

Helen

messages.subject: what is unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: Well.... the resounding response to what I wrote the other day tells me otherwise. If you re interested I ll share some of them with you - or anyone - onlist
messages.messageBody:
"Well.... the resounding response to what I wrote the other day tells
me otherwise. If you're interested I'll share some of them with you -
or anyone - onlist or off. But I warn you: It's pretty eye-opening
reading, from some of the most respected voices in homeschooling and
unschooling."

I think it would be nice if you posted a link to a list that is
discussing this issue Helen, for those that are interested.
I don't think it belongs here because I want the list to stay true
to it's purpose of helping newer folks understand unschooling and
the lifestyle. I hope everyone understands.

But if there is a list that is talking about this, please post it so
that it can be discussed by those that want to further explore the
issue.

Thanks!

Ren
